description: Updates a set of chat controls configured for an existing Amazon Q Business application.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The identifier of the application for which the chat controls are configured.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A token that you provide to identify the request to update a Amazon Q Business application chat configuration. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: orchestrationConfiguration
parameters.description: The chat response orchestration settings for your application. Status information about whether chat orchestration is activated or deactivated for your Amazon Q Business application.

nested_params.name: control
nested_params.description: Status information about whether chat orchestration is activated or deactivated for your Amazon Q Business application.

parameters.name: blockedPhrasesConfigurationUpdate
parameters.description: The phrases blocked from chat by your chat control configuration. blockedPhrasesToCreateOrUpdate (list) --- Creates or updates a blocked phrases configuration in your Amazon Q Business application. (string) --- blockedPhrasesToDelete (list) --- Deletes a blocked phrases configuration in your Amazon Q Business application. (string) --- systemMessageOverride (string) --- The configured custom message displayed to your end user when they use blocked phrase during chat.

nested_params.name: blockedPhrasesToCreateOrUpdate
nested_params.description: Creates or updates a blocked phrases configuration in your Amazon Q Business application.

nested_params.name: blockedPhrasesToDelete
nested_params.description: Deletes a blocked phrases configuration in your Amazon Q Business application.

nested_params.name: systemMessageOverride
nested_params.description: The configured custom message displayed to your end user when they use blocked phrase during chat.

parameters.name: topicConfigurationsToCreateOrUpdate
parameters.description: The configured topic specific chat controls you want to update. (dict) --- The topic specific controls configured for an Amazon Q Business application. A name for your topic control configuration. description (string) --- A description for your topic control configuration. Use this to outline how the large language model (LLM) should use this topic control configuration. exampleChatMessages (list) --- A list of example phrases that you expect the end user to use in relation to the topic. (string) --- Rules defined for a topic configuration. (dict) --- Guardrail rules for an Amazon Q Business application. Amazon Q Business supports only one rule at a time. includedUsersAndGroups (dict) --- Users and groups to be included in a rule. userIds (list) --- The user ids associated with a topic control rule. (string) --- userGroups (list) --- The user group names associated with a topic control rule. (string) --- excludedUsersAndGroups (dict) --- Users and groups to be excluded from a rule. (string) --- The type of rule. ruleConfiguration (dict) --- The configuration information for a rule. contentBlockerRule (dict) --- A rule for configuring how Amazon Q Business responds when it encounters a a blocked topic. systemMessageOverride (string) --- The configured custom message displayed to an end user informing them that they've used a blocked phrase during chat. contentRetrievalRule (dict) --- Rules for retrieving content from data sources connected to a Amazon Q Business application for a specific topic control configuration. eligibleDataSources (list) --- Specifies data sources in a Amazon Q Business application to use for content generation. (dict) --- The identifier of the data source Amazon Q Business will generate responses from. indexId (string) --- The identifier of the index the data source is attached to. dataSourceId (string) --- The identifier of the data source.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: A name for your topic control configuration.

nested_params.name: description
nested_params.description: A description for your topic control configuration. Use this to outline how the large language model (LLM) should use this topic control configuration.

nested_params.name: exampleChatMessages
nested_params.description: A list of example phrases that you expect the end user to use in relation to the topic.

nested_params.name: rules
nested_params.description: Rules defined for a topic configuration.

nested_params.name: includedUsersAndGroups
nested_params.description: Users and groups to be included in a rule.

nested_params.name: userIds
nested_params.description: The user ids associated with a topic control rule.

nested_params.name: userGroups
nested_params.description: The user group names associated with a topic control rule.

nested_params.name: excludedUsersAndGroups
nested_params.description: Users and groups to be excluded from a rule.

nested_params.name: userIds
nested_params.description: The user ids associated with a topic control rule.

nested_params.name: userGroups
nested_params.description: The user group names associated with a topic control rule.

nested_params.name: ruleType
nested_params.description: The type of rule.

nested_params.name: ruleConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configuration information for a rule.

nested_params.name: contentBlockerRule
nested_params.description: A rule for configuring how Amazon Q Business responds when it encounters a a blocked topic.

nested_params.name: systemMessageOverride
nested_params.description: The configured custom message displayed to an end user informing them that they've used a blocked phrase during chat.

nested_params.name: contentRetrievalRule
nested_params.description: Rules for retrieving content from data sources connected to a Amazon Q Business application for a specific topic control configuration.

nested_params.name: eligibleDataSources
nested_params.description: Specifies data sources in a Amazon Q Business application to use for content generation.

nested_params.name: indexId
nested_params.description: The identifier of the index the data source is attached to.

nested_params.name: dataSourceId
nested_params.description: The identifier of the data source.

(string) --- Rules defined for a topic configuration. (dict) --- Guardrail rules for an Amazon Q Business application. (dict) --- The identifier of the data source Amazon Q Business will generate responses from. indexId (string) --- The identifier of the index the data source is attached to. dataSourceId (string) --- The identifier of the data source.

parameters.name: creatorModeConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration details for CREATOR_MODE. Status information about whether CREATOR_MODE has been enabled or disabled. The default status is DISABLED.

nested_params.name: creatorModeControl
nested_params.description: Status information about whether CREATOR_MODE has been enabled or disabled. The default status is DISABLED.

parameters.name: hallucinationReductionConfiguration
parameters.description: The hallucination reduction settings for your application. hallucinationReductionControl (string) --- Controls whether hallucination reduction has been enabled or disabled for your application. The default status is DISABLED.

nested_params.name: hallucinationReductionControl
nested_params.description: Controls whether hallucination reduction has been enabled or disabled for your application. The default status is DISABLED.
